text: all of our products are solving some
problem in your everyday life my first
application was herself something that I
found annoying which was when your
earphones get tangled I wanted to save
time from having to do that every day
and I naturally started to get feedback
from friends about whether they thought
it was useful whether they thought it
could be improved and I just kept
iterating on the designs from there
founded in 2013 behold as a company that
uses 3d printing to create accessories
with what they call responsive product
design this allows them to quickly alter
their products to meet a rapidly
changing marketplace you don't have to
lock into any one version it can keep
improving and so you'll be able to
access the latest one for example when
you have new phones come out and then
suddenly that last generation it's not
relevant anymore
but if you were to produce this to a
more modern process then you would be
able to just adapt and not have so much
inventory wasted industrial 3d printing
facilities like shapeways out in Long
Island City are reshaping design from
inception to product unlike in years
past items can be printed quickly in
small quantities and in a variety of
materials the hook is a really
interesting use case of that we've
tested that one a lot and we hollowed
out the inside but made it ribbed and
it's printed in a certain orientation to
ensure that that's the strongest
orientation so that at the end of the
day this super lightweight hook is just
weighs one ounce is now going to hold up
up to 25 pounds
these kinds of facilities are opening up
the market to people who would not have
had access before at the moment we get
over 120,000 designs uploaded per month
so it's a lot coming through
it ranges everyone from amateur were
trying to learn how to use software the
first time through the architects doing
maquettes and models of the building
through to designers who have put their
products online for sale via jewelry an
iPhone case some dice a GoPro camera
mount it used to be the developers
always had to work for large companies
and now you have so many independent
developers so it's going to really start
up this new world of independent and
creative designers within three months
we were able to launch a set of four new
products from beginning to end and so
that's something that I think is just
not possible if we were going through
the normal process we might have just
been born with one product and so it's
really shows how big of a leap we've
made forward in in terms of what we can
do now with products
